channel.title: How to work with local proxy outside the box
channel.description: I have a local proxy software running at the host OS, and want to tunnel Tor inside the box through the local proxy outside the box, would be difficult to do so?

item.title: How to work with local proxy outside the box
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Linux user account isolation is not very strong anyhow. See:

Whonix

Dev/Permissions

Development Notes about File System Permissions, passwordless sudo and user account separation

We don’t have it fully documented how to run a custom proxy tunnel software on a Non-Qubes-Whonix-Gateway. Very much likely doable.

You would have to run it under the linux user account tunnel. (Otherwise the tunnel software would have no clearnet (non-torified) internet access for itself.)

See also generally:

Whonix

Tunnels/Introduction

Instructions on how to combine tunnels (VPN, SSH, proxy) with Tor. (User -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> Internet) (User -> proxy/VPN/SSH ->...

More specifically on how to configure Tor to use the proxy:
(host would be 127.0.0.1. port: you name it)

Whonix

Tunnels/Connecting to a proxy before Tor

Instructions on how to connect to a proxy before Tor (User -> proxy -> Tor -> Internet)

item.title: How to work with local proxy outside the box
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
One can ssh into a Whonix-Gateway.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/File_Transfer#SSH_into_Whonix-Gateway

As well as into a Whonix-Workstation.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/File_Transfer#SSH_into_Whonix-Workstation

Perhaps reverse ssh something?

Or install the local proxy in the gateway instead? Use case?

Perhaps bridged networking or maybe better a host-only network adapter can help? Both have warnings. Which could use some more research, rewrite and documentation. Don’t hold your breath for it to happen anytime soon.

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Security_Guide#Warning:_Bridged_Networking
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Security_Guide#Adding_Host-Only_Networking_adapter_to_Whonix-Workstation_.2F_SSH_into_Whonix-Workstation

item.title: How to work with local proxy outside the box
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
Not sure I understand your configuration. You need to provide more details. Depending on the proxy, it might be difficult or even impossible because Virtualbox networking resides on OSI Layer 2 (ie doesn’t speak TCP/IP),

If it’s an SSH tunnel you are talking about, then it’s possible using instructions like this: http://ku1ik.com/2011/11/12/tunnel-vm-network-ssh.html. This is neither supported nor tested so proceed at your own risk. Generally, it is not a good idea to alter networking unless you understand what you’re doing.
